text: Emilio Álvarez Montalván (31 July 1919 - 2 July 2014) was a Nicaraguan diplomat and politician. He served as the Foreign Minister of the Republic of Nicaragua from 1996 until 2001. He was an ophthalmologist, medical doctor and writer. Álvarez was born in Managua. He was married to Carmen Guerra. They had six children. Álvarez died from a heart attack on 2 July 2014, aged 94. ==References== Category:2014 deaths Category:1919 births Category:Nicaraguan politicians Category:Diplomats Category:Physicians Category:Nicaraguan writers
